page.title: 14The Flying Farmer
page.content: The present occupant of Ledburn Farm, who has leased it since 1968, uses part of the ground as a {landing strip for his own Cessna 'plane, which he shares with another man in Leighton Buzzard - his third partner in the six years since the 'plane was purchased. He uses the 'plane for business and pleasure and he says it is no more expensive to run than a Range Rover, doing 20 miles to the gallon and, of course, it saves a lot of time on many journeys. The 'plane is 24 years old. The farmer learned to fly in 1975 and now his son is learning as well. The farmhouse was built about 80 years ago and the farm belongs to a trust administered by the Society of Merchant Venturers in Bristol, who bought it from Lord Rosebery of Mentmore in 1945.
